data.title: Oscar Wilde -Attempt to Make a Fair Memory
data.text:
Oscar Wilde - Attempt to Make a Fair Memory The sketch of the script – Svetozar Jovičin CHARACTERS: Oscar Wilde, in contrast to time, carried the power of the sword through the articulation of the voice and with the assessment of society the measure of scales that, with the reflection and judgment, turned against him. Constance Wilde. Between the clouds and the light after which a rainbow and sadness were born Cyril and Vyvyan children Father and Mother William and Franceska Wilde Brother and Sister William and Isola Wilde Percival - painter, mainly dressed in light yellow and light orange Dorian Gray - mostly dressed in a green coat with stars Three fairies - dressed in veils in variable colors Lord Alfred Douglas, Bosie and his father, Marquess of Queensberry Robert Ross Judge Salome (alone or with seven dancers wearing different veils) St. John Some friends (they can remind of Dali, Yesenin, Isidora Duncan, DH Lawrence, Anais Nin and people from some other times) A boy (Parts of the text in certain places from "De Profundis" , Selfish Giant, Nightingale and Rose, The Picture of Dorian Gray) It is possible to replace the music *with the Đoŵposers work ... (Possibility of making MP3 Records in the form of Radio Drama and Cartoon Strip, all on the web page ...) The Beginning In front of an old house with a garden and a decorative fence through which you can look inside there is an audience that when entering more than two, three steps into that yard gets a green rose. Characteristic characters of an older gentleman with a beard and gentle appearance and hands, a girl with a smile in green eyes. .. The entrance of people like Dali, Yesenin and Isidora ...

As they pass, occasionally in the garden in a mild semi-circle, Oscar Wilde appears (and disappears) several times in his characteristic suit with a pelerine and a stick. When entering the hall, the audience sits down and puts roses at the ends of the rows into vases. And The First Scene On the scene, Percival is in his silk veil (yellow and orange) while the art of the school of Pre- Raphaelite is shown on the canvas. He stands up and passes in front of the canvas in a mild footstep and starts the dialogue with the pictures. For example,  In the mid-19th century, imagination from the wooden Celtic world, through some William Morris, DaŶte Gaďriel ‘osetti aŶd Edǁard BurŶs JoŶess frieŶds, fell into English art. Among the paintings on the canvas are Loǀe and Death with a large figure of Death and Love as a boy. The question he poses to this picture: "Does this boy have the ability to defend himself from such a power of death?", passing by the picture, "The Beguiling of Merlin," he asks: "If we start the paths of love and step out of its magic" The third picture shows the man on the throne under whose hands there is a carved sad and funny figure, "Where are the keys of the variability of power?" After this conversation with pictures, Percival says: "Oscar Wilde was born at that time." There sound of a triangle can be heard (possible on a video) following the pronunciation of the names. Oskar, Fingal, O ' Flahertie (singing Irish). At the same time, on the video, the plunging of a small child into the water can be seen. On the scene, 3 fairies (in yellow, red and blue) in the forms of the New Hellenic spiral move with the pronunciation of these names. They can react on the move of the painter. The Second Scene Children's landscape. The Oscars hides behind a bush when playing with his brother and sister. And he watches his mother and father. Mother writes a speech whose fragments are heard, Irish national streams.
